    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ et against the action-packed world of Mixed Martial Arts, NEVER BACK DOWN is the    Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ story of Jake Tyler, a tough kid who leads with his fists, and, often, with his     Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ heart.  Jake Tyler, played by Sean Faris (Yours, Mine and Ours), is the new kid in  Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ town with a troubled past.  He has recently moved to Orlando, Florida with his      Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ family who has relocated to support his younger brother&#039;s shot at a professional    Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ tennis career.  Jake was a star athlete on the football team at home, but in this   Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ new city he is an outsider with a reputation for being a quick tempered brawler.    Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³                                                                                     Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³  Making an attempt to fit in, and at the invitation of a flirtatious classmate,     Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ Baja, played by Amber Heard (Hidden Palms, Alpha Dog), Jake goes to a party where   Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ he is unwittingly pulled into a fight with a bully named Ryan McCarthy, played by   Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ Cam Gigandet (The O.C., Who&#039;s Your Caddy?).  While he is defeated and humiliated    Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ in the fight, a classmate introduces himself to Jake and tells him about the sport  Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ known as Mixed Martial Arts (MMA).  He sees a star in Jake and asks that he meet    Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ with his mentor, Jean Roqua, played by Djimon Hounsou (Blood Diamond, In America).  Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³                                                                                     Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ t is immediately apparent to Jake that MMA is not street fighting, but rather an    Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ art form he wants to master.  Roqua will take Jake under his wing, but it is up to  Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ Jake to find the patience, discipline, willingness and reason within him to         Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ succeed.  For Jake, there is much more at stake than mere victory.  His decision    Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
    Ã‚Â²Ã‚Â³ will not just settle a score; it will define who he is.                             Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â±
